title: 108_s864
content: The "National Guard and Reserves Child Care Relief Act" authorizes appropriations for child care assistance for military dependents under the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2004 to 2008 for this purpose. The Secretary will provide grants to eligible persons to help pay for child care services for dependents by eligible child care providers. A dependent is defined as an individual meeting specific criteria, and an eligible person is a parent of a dependent who is a member of a reserve component of the Armed Forces on active duty for more than 30 days in support of a military operation. The Secretary provides grants to eligible parents of dependents in the Armed Forces on active duty for child care services if they have primary responsibility for the care of the dependents and live at least 50 miles from military child care facilities. To be eligible for a grant, a person must submit an application to the Department of Defense, including information about the child care provider. The grant is available for use by dependents during military operations such as Operation Enduring Freedom, Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Noble Eagle, or any successor operation. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Section 658O of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 is amended to specify changes in the allocation of funds under different sections.
